newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Astra lifts Swedish shares to end higher.
newsitem.headline: Astra lifts Swedish shares to end higher.

text.p: Share prices ended higher on Thursday after coming off intra-day levels, helped by late rallies in drugs major Astra and car safety equipment maker Autoliv.
The general index rose 0.82 percent to 2,801.15 in turnover totalling 5.25 billion crowns.

Drug company Astra jumped 8.5 crowns to 323.5 on rumours the company would received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for its Pulmicort Turbuhaler this summer. No one at Astra was immediately available for comment.
Rival Pharmacia & Upjohn rose three to 258.5 crowns.
Autoliv jumped 10.5 crowns to 304.5. Brokers said the share was considered cheap in view of recent selling by U.S. investors.
Metals and mining group Trelleborg gained 5.5 crowns to 137.5 amid speculation how much the company will gain from spinning off its Boliden unit.
Appliance maker Electrolux slid 22 crowns to 460, off a session low of 438, as it was traded excluding rights to shares in Granges, a unit it is spinning off.
